channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Medical groups are concerned that RFK Jr. may dismiss a panel of primary care experts
item.description: The American Medical Association is urging HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. not to oust members of the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force, an independent group of experts focused on primary care.
item.content:encoded:
The American Medical Association is urging HHS Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. not to oust members of the U.S. Preventive Services Task Force, an independent group of experts focused on primary care.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Tom Lehrer, influential musical satirist, dies at 97
item.description: The songwriter and math professor found a following with his satirical political songs.
item.content:encoded:
The songwriter and math professor found a following with his satirical political songs.

(Image credit: Evening Standard)
item.dc:creator: Art Silverman

item.title: The fascinating career of Ichiro Suzuki
item.description: Ichiro Suzuki has just been inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame. NPR's Scott Detrow talks to Shannon Drayer about one of the most fascinating careers in Major League Baseball history.
item.content:encoded: Ichiro Suzuki has just been inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame. NPR's Scott Detrow talks to Shannon Drayer about one of the most fascinating careers in Major League Baseball history.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Pierre

item.title: USA swim team members recovering from stomach bug at world championships
item.description: Some USA swim team members have missed events during the competition.
item.content:encoded:
Some USA swim team members have missed events during the competition.

(Image credit: Vincent Thian)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Trump sets EU tariff at 15%, lower than his original threat, after meeting in Scotland
item.description: Trump had most recently threatened tariffs of 30% on imports from the European Union. But on Sunday, he met with the president of the European Commission, and they agreed to a lower level.
item.content:encoded:
Trump had most recently threatened tariffs of 30% on imports from the European Union. But on Sunday, he met with the president of the European Commission, and they agreed to a lower level.

(Image credit: Brendan Smialowski)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: His name is Mohammad Al-Motawaq. He is 18 months old. And he is starving in Gaza
item.description: Hidaya Al-Motawaq's son is a year and a half old and weighs less than 10 pounds. Doctors warn of permanent damage to children's health due to chronic malnutrition from Israel's earlier blockade.
item.content:encoded:
Hidaya Al-Motawaq's son is a year and a half old and weighs less than 10 pounds. Doctors warn of permanent damage to children's health due to chronic malnutrition from Israel's earlier blockade.

(Image credit: Anas Baba)
item.dc:creator: Anas Baba

item.title: Thai and Cambodian leaders to meet in Malaysia for talks to end deadly border dispute
item.description: Thai and Cambodian leaders will meet in Malaysia for talks to end hostilities, a spokesperson for the Thai prime minister's office said on Sunday.
item.content:encoded:
Thai and Cambodian leaders will meet in Malaysia for talks to end hostilities, a spokesperson for the Thai prime minister's office said on Sunday.

(Image credit: Sakchai Lalit)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: How a flat tire scam in Colombia can lead to costly car repairs
item.description: Bandits on motorcycles secretly spread sharp objects on the road to puncture car tires. Then, they offer to lead marooned motorists to nearby mechanics suspected of being in on the con.
item.content:encoded:
Bandits on motorcycles secretly spread sharp objects on the road to puncture car tires. Then, they offer to lead marooned motorists to nearby mechanics suspected of being in on the con.

(Image credit: John Otis for NPR)
item.dc:creator: John Otis

item.title: Doctors warn that children in Gaza have suffered irreversible damage from starvation
item.description: Prolonged and severe malnutrition is permanently damaging the health of children across Gaza. Doctors warn even if Israel lets in more food now, the damage to children's bodies can be irreversible.
item.content:encoded: Prolonged and severe malnutrition is permanently damaging the health of children across Gaza. Doctors warn even if Israel lets in more food now, the damage to children's bodies can be irreversible.
item.dc:creator: Anas Baba

item.title: 'Hell on Earth': Venezuelans deported to El Salvador mega-prison tell of brutal abuse
item.description: Deported under a little-known wartime law, more than 130 Venezuelans were sent from the U.S. to a maximum-security prison in El Salvador. Now released, several tell NPR they endured beatings, sexual abuse, and near-total isolation.
item.content:encoded:
Deported under a little-known wartime law, more than 130 Venezuelans were sent from the U.S. to a maximum-security prison in El Salvador. Now released, several tell NPR they endured beatings, sexual abuse, and near-total isolation.

(Image credit: El Salvador Press Presidency Office)
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán
